positions.subtitle: Team KART
positions.description: • Team Leader of the Official Formula Student Team of IIT Kharagpur.• Responsible for leading a team toward all aspects of the research & development of a Formula Student   prototype vehicle, devised procurement strategies for efficient budget utilization & guided   sponsorship initiatives of the team.• Prepared the design & manufacturing timeline as well as the procurement plan for the fund allocation   to secure the required funding for the team and ensure an efficient workflow for project K6.
positions.title: Team Leader
positions.description_html:
• Team Leader of the Official Formula Student Team of IIT Kharagpur.
• Responsible for leading a team toward all aspects of the research & development of a Formula Student
prototype vehicle, devised procurement strategies for efficient budget utilization & guided
sponsorship initiatives of the team.
• Prepared the design & manufacturing timeline as well as the procurement plan for the fund allocation
to secure the required funding for the team and ensure an efficient workflow for project K6.

positions.subtitle: Team KART
positions.description: Design• Designed & engineered an intake manifold for an FSAE car by performing simulations in ANSYS Fluent    which brought an 11% increase in performance• Performed model engine simulations in Ricardo WAVE for a combustion engine to measure the    performance & efficiency characteristics of the engine• Prototyped the design of a new reactive muffler which led to a weight reduction of 28% & verified the    design by performing simulations in COMSOL• Developed a program to perform vehicle simulations to estimate the performance of a vehicle, in    MATLAB and SimulinkManufacturing• Leading the manufacturing effort of the newly designed powertrain components for the current   Formula Student vehicle project, the K6• Responsible for ensuring coordination between the powertrain subsystem and the rest of the team to    ensure the smooth running of the manufacturing and procurement timelines.
positions.title: Powertrain Subsystem Head
positions.description_html:
Design
• Designed & engineered an intake manifold for an FSAE car by performing simulations in ANSYS Fluent
which brought an 11% increase in performance
• Performed model engine simulations in Ricardo WAVE for a combustion engine to measure the
performance & efficiency characteristics of the engine
• Prototyped the design of a new reactive muffler which led to a weight reduction of 28% & verified the
design by performing simulations in COMSOL
• Developed a program to perform vehicle simulations to estimate the performance of a vehicle, in
MATLAB and Simulink

Manufacturing
• Leading the manufacturing effort of the newly designed powertrain components for the current
Formula Student vehicle project, the K6
• Responsible for ensuring coordination between the powertrain subsystem and the rest of the team to
ensure the smooth running of the manufacturing and procurement timelines.

positions.subtitle: Team KART
positions.description: 1. Basic knowledge of the working of Internal Combustion engines pertaining to Formula student competitions :  a. Model engine simulations in Ricardo WAVE for a complete Internal combustion engine to obtain       valuable information       pertaining to the efficiency and working of an engine.  b. Static and Transient CFD analysis for an intake manifold based on specific boundary conditions       to  obtain pressure contours and verify the mass flow rate obtained from the Ricardo WAVE       simulations.  c. Turbocharger selection based on given engine criteria and engine data obtained from Ricardo       WAVE simulation for a specific horsepower target.  d. Performed lap time simulations on Optimum lap based on specific engine parameters to       determine the optimum Final Drive Ratio(FDR) for minimum lap times .2. Fundamental knowledge of the drivetrain of an FSAE engine for proper transfer of energy to the tires:  a.  Basic analysis of gears and the forces acting on them.  b.  Designed a sprocket for a chain-driven drivetrain solution and performed force and torque       calculations and simulations on ANSYS to determine the various loads on the sprocket and to       confirm it's feasibility.   c. Performed analysis and force calculations on various iterations of planetary gears to determine        the best solution for an optimized drivetrain setup for the Formula Student electric vehicle.
positions.title: Powertrain Member
positions.description_html:
1. Basic knowledge of the working of Internal Combustion engines pertaining to Formula student competitions :
a. Model engine simulations in Ricardo WAVE for a complete Internal combustion engine to obtain
valuable information
pertaining to the efficiency and working of an engine.
b. Static and Transient CFD analysis for an intake manifold based on specific boundary conditions
to obtain pressure contours and verify the mass flow rate obtained from the Ricardo WAVE
simulations.
c. Turbocharger selection based on given engine criteria and engine data obtained from Ricardo
WAVE simulation for a specific horsepower target.
d. Performed lap time simulations on Optimum lap based on specific engine parameters to
determine the optimum Final Drive Ratio(FDR) for minimum lap times .

2. Fundamental knowledge of the drivetrain of an FSAE engine for proper transfer of energy to the tires:
a. Basic analysis of gears and the forces acting on them.
b. Designed a sprocket for a chain-driven drivetrain solution and performed force and torque
calculations and simulations on ANSYS to determine the various loads on the sprocket and to
confirm it's feasibility.
c. Performed analysis and force calculations on various iterations of planetary gears to determine
the best solution for an optimized drivetrain setup for the Formula Student electric vehicle.
